edits.text: # Arch Linux Dotfiles - Automated Installation Framework
**Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for Arch Linux + KDE Plasma 6 (Wayland)**
- Creates and enrolls Secure Boot keys
- Creates pacman hooks for automatic re-signing on updates
- Secure Boot enforcement on Lenovo LOQ
- Nvidia RTX 3050 driver compatibility with Secure Boot
# Reboot to enable Secure Boot in BIOS
- Creates restore script for Spotify updates
Stow automatically creates symlinks from `modules/` to `$HOME`.
### Check What Would Be Stowed (Dry Run)
- Enable Secure Boot in BIOS/UEFI after first boot
- If boot fails, disable Secure Boot and run `sudo sbctl verify`
- Modules auto-signed on kernel updates via pacman hooks
- If Nvidia fails to load: `sudo sbctl sign-all && sudo update-initramfs -u`
- Some settings require re-login to apply
- Konsave profiles may not include all extensions
- Manually install Latte Dock or other plasmoids if needed
- After Spotify updates, Spicetify may break
- Marketplace allows theme/extension installation from Spotify UI
# Run module manually to see detailed errors
This is a personal dotfiles repository, but feel free to fork and adapt for your own setup!
MIT License - Do whatever you want with this code.

message.text:
1. El Módulo del Shell (Zsh + Plugins)
En tu README.md mencionas Zsh como ejemplo, y tu fastfetch lo detecta, pero no has creado el módulo real para instalar Oh My Zsh, Powerlevel10k, y tus plugins (autosuggestions, syntax highlighting). Si corres el instalador ahora en una PC nueva, tendrás una terminal Zsh "pelada" y fea.

Solución: Crea modules/shell/setup.sh.

Bash

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# modules/shell/setup.sh
# Instala Zsh, Oh My Zsh, Powerlevel10k y Plugins necesarios

set -euo pipefail

# Instalar Zsh y Nerd Fonts (Necesarias para los iconos)
echo "📦 Instalando Zsh y fuentes..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm zsh ttf-jetbrains-mono-nerd ttf-font-awesome

# Cambiar shell por defecto a Zsh
if [[ "$SHELL" != */zsh ]]; then
    echo "🐚 Cambiando shell por defecto a Zsh..."
    chsh -s $(which zsh)
fi

# Instalar Oh My Zsh (si no existe)
if [[ ! -d "$HOME/.oh-my-zsh" ]]; then
    echo "✨ Instalando Oh My Zsh..."
    sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)" "" --unattended
fi

# Instalar Plugins (Autosuggestions + Syntax Highlighting)
ZSH_CUSTOM="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh/custom"

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions" ]]; then
    echo "💡 Instalando zsh-autosuggestions..."
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions
fi

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting" ]]; then
    echo "🎨 Instalando zsh-syntax-highlighting..."
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting
fi

# Instalar Tema Powerlevel10k
if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/themes/powerlevel10k" ]]; then
    echo "🚀 Instalando Powerlevel10k..."
    git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/romkatv/powerlevel10k.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/themes/powerlevel10k
fi

# NOTA: Asegúrate de tener tu archivo .zshrc y .p10k.zsh en:
# modules/shell/.zshrc
# modules/shell/.p10k.zsh
# El script 'install.sh' maestro se encargará de hacerles symlink con Stow.

echo "✅ Shell module completado."
2. Variables de Entorno para Nvidia + Wayland
Tienes el módulo de Secure Boot para firmar los drivers (¡excelente!), pero te falta configurar el sistema para que KDE Wayland use la RTX 3050 correctamente sin parpadeos ni lag.

Solución: Agrega un pequeño archivo de configuración o un módulo "system" para crear /etc/environment o un archivo en /etc/profile.d/.

Crea modules/system/setup.sh:

Bash

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# modules/system/setup.sh
# Configura variables de entorno para Nvidia Wayland y optimizaciones

set -euo pipefail

echo "🔧 Configurando variables de entorno para Nvidia Wayland..."

# Archivo de variables globales
ENV_FILE="/etc/profile.d/nvidia-wayland.sh"

# Contenido recomendado para Nvidia serie 3000+ en Wayland
sudo tee "$ENV_FILE" > /dev/null <<EOF
# Forzar backend GBM (Crítico para Nvidia Wayland)
export GBM_BACKEND=nvidia-drm
export __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia

# Fix para aplicaciones Electron (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) en Wayland
export NVD_BACKEND=direct
export ELECTRON_OZONE_PLATFORM_HINT=auto

# Firefox Wayland
export MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1

# Renderizado de KDE
export KWIN_DRM_USE_MODIFIERS=1
EOF

echo "🎮 Instalando Gamemode para juegos..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm gamemode lib32-gamemode

# Añadir usuario al grupo gamemode
sudo usermod -aG gamemode $USER

echo "✅ System module completado. Reinicia para aplicar cambios." dotfiles-ArchLinux/
├── install.sh                  (YA LO TIENES - MAESTRO)
├── README.md                   (YA LO TIENES)
└── modules/
    ├── secureboot/             (YA LO TIENES - CRÍTICO)
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── spotify/                (YA LO TIENES - SOLUCIÓN NATIVA)

    ├── visuals/                (YA LO TIENES - FASTFETCH/KDE)
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── shell/                  (⚠️ NUEVO - ZSH)
    │   ├── setup.sh

    │   └── .p10k.zsh           <-- Copia tu actual ~/.p10k.zsh aquí
    └── system/                 (⚠️ NUEVO - NVIDIA ENV)

edits.text:
**Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for Arch Linux + KDE Plasma 6 (Wayland)**

---

## Directory Structure

```
dotfiles-ArchLinux/
├── install.sh                          # Master orchestrator script
├── README.md                           # This file
│
└── modules/                            # Modular installation components
    │
    ├── secureboot/                     # Secure Boot automation
    │   └── setup.sh                    # sbctl + kernel/Nvidia signing
    │
    ├── shell/                          # Zsh configuration
    │   ├── setup.sh                    # Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
    │   ├── .zshrc                      # Zsh config (copy yours here)
    │   └── .p10k.zsh                   # Powerlevel10k config
    │
    ├── system/                         # System optimizations
    │   └── setup.sh                    # Nvidia Wayland env vars + gamemode
    │
    ├── visuals/                        # Visual customization
    │   ├── setup.sh                    # Fastfetch + Terminal + KDE
    │   ├── .config/
    │   │   ├── fastfetch/
    │   │   │   └── config.jsonc        # Custom fastfetch config
    │   │   └── kitty/
    │   │       └── kitty.conf          # Kitty terminal config
    │   ├── .local/
    │   │   └── share/
    │   │       └── konsole/            # Konsole profiles (optional)
    │   ├── kde-configs/                # KDE Plasma backups
    │   │   └── konsave-profile.knsv   # Konsave export
    │   └── wallpapers/                 # Wallpaper images

Module Breakdown

### 1. Secure Boot Module (`modules/secureboot/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs and configures `sbctl`
- Creates and enrolls Secure Boot keys
- Signs kernel, Nvidia modules, and bootloader
- Creates pacman hooks for automatic re-signing on updates

**Critical for:**
- Secure Boot enforcement on Lenovo LOQ
- Nvidia RTX 3050 driver compatibility with Secure Boot

**Post-installation:**
```bash
sudo sbctl status
sudo sbctl list-files
```

---

### 2. Shell Module (`modules/shell/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Changes default shell to Zsh
- Installs Oh My Zsh
- Installs plugins: zsh-autosuggestions, zsh-syntax-highlighting
- Installs Powerlevel10k theme

**Important:**
Copy your personal configs to the module:
```bash
cp ~/.zshrc ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/shell/
cp ~/.p10k.zsh ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/shell/
```

---

### 3. System Module (`modules/system/`)

**What it does:**
- Configures Nvidia Wayland environment variables
- Enables proper GBM backend for Nvidia
- Fixes Electron apps (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) on Wayland
- Enables Firefox Wayland mode
- Installs gamemode for gaming performance

**Creates:** `/etc/profile.d/nvidia-wayland.sh`

**Post-installation:** Reboot to apply environment variables

---

### 4. Visuals Module (`modules/visuals/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs **Fastfetch** with custom config
- Configures **Kitty** or **Konsole** terminal
- Installs **KDE Plasma** customization tools
- Restores KDE settings via **konsave** (if available)
- Applies wallpapers
- Installs KWin scripts/effects

**Included configs:**
- `fastfetch/config.jsonc` - System info display
- `kitty/kitty.conf` - Terminal theme
- `kde-configs/` - Full KDE Plasma backup

**To backup your current KDE setup:**
```bash
pip install konsave --user
konsave -s mysetup
konsave -e mysetup
mv ~/.config/konsave/profiles/mysetup.knsv \
   ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/visuals/kde-configs/
```

---

### 5. Spotify Module (`modules/spotify/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs **Spotify** from AUR (native, not Flatpak)
- Fixes `/opt/spotify` permissions (critical for Spicetify)
- Installs **Spicetify CLI** from AUR
- Installs **Spicetify Marketplace**
- Applies theme

Quick Start

### 1. Clone Repository

```bash
git clone <your-repo-url> ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux
cd ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux
```

### 2. Copy Your Personal Configs

**Important:** Before running the installer, copy your current configs:

```bash
# Shell configs
cp ~/.zshrc modules/shell/
cp ~/.p10k.zsh modules/shell/

# Add your wallpapers
cp ~/Pictures/wallpapers/* modules/visuals/wallpapers/

# Optional: Backup KDE settings
pip install konsave --user
konsave -s current
konsave -e current
mv ~/.config/konsave/profiles/current.knsv modules/visuals/kde-configs/
```

### 3. Run Master Installer

```bash
chmod +x install.sh
./install.sh
```

The script will:
- Auto-detect all modules
- Show progress bars with colors
- Install each module sequentially
- Symlink configs using GNU Stow
- Provide detailed summary

### 4. Reboot

```bash
reboot
```

After reboot, enable Secure Boot in BIOS if desired.

Customization Guide

### Adding Your Own Configs

The modular structure makes it easy to add any configuration.

**Example: Adding Git config**

1. Create module structure:
```bash
mkdir -p modules/git
```

2. Add your config files:
```bash
cp ~/.gitconfig modules/git/
```

3. Create `modules/git/setup.sh`:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Installing Git..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm git

echo "Git module completed"
```

4. Make executable:
```bash
chmod +x modules/git

System Requirements

**Hardware:**
- CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 7000 Series
- GPU: Nvidia RTX 3050 6GB (Hybrid Graphics)

Usage Examples

### Install Everything
```bash
./install.sh
```

### Install Single Module
```bash
cd modules/spotify
bash setup.sh
```

### Re-apply Symlinks Only
```bash
cd modules
stow -v -t $HOME */
```

### Check What Would Be Stowed (Dry Run)
```bash
cd modules
stow -n -v -t $HOME visuals
```

---

## Important Notes

### Secure Boot
- Reboot required after secure boot setup
- Enable Secure Boot in BIOS/UEFI after first boot
- If boot fails, disable Secure Boot and run `sudo sbctl verify`

### Nvidia Drivers + Wayland
- System module configures critical environment variables
- Modules auto-signed on kernel updates via pacman hooks
- If Nvidia fails to load: `sudo sbctl sign-all`

### Shell (Zsh)
- Shell change requires re-login to take effect
- Run `p10k configure` to customize Powerlevel10k after first login

### KDE Plasma
- Some settings require re-login to apply
- Konsave profiles may not include all extensions
- Manually install Latte Dock or other plasmoids if needed

### Spotify
- After Spotify updates, Spicetify may break
- Run `modules/spotify/restore-spicetify.sh` to fix
- Marketplace allows theme/extension installation from Spotify UI

---

##

Additional Resources

- [Arch Wiki - Secure Boot](https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Unified_Extensible_Firmware_Interface/Secure_Boot)
- [sbctl Documentation](https://github.com/Foxboron/sbctl)
- [Spicetify CLI](https://spicetify.app/)
- [GNU Stow Manual](https://www.gnu.org/software/stow/manual/stow.html)
- [Konsave GitHub](https://github.com/Prayag2/konsave)
- [Fastfetch](https://github.com/fastfetch-cli/fastfetch)
- [Powerlevel10k](https://github.com/romkatv/powerlevel10k)

---

## License

MIT License - Do whatever you want with this code.

---

**Made for Arch Linux | Lenovo LOQ | RTX 3050**

<userRequest>
1. El Módulo del Shell (Zsh + Plugins)
En tu README.md mencionas Zsh como ejemplo, y tu fastfetch lo detecta, pero no has creado el módulo real para instalar Oh My Zsh, Powerlevel10k, y tus plugins (autosuggestions, syntax highlighting). Si corres el instalador ahora en una PC nueva, tendrás una terminal Zsh "pelada" y fea.

Solución: Crea modules/shell/setup.sh.

Bash

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# modules/shell/setup.sh
# Instala Zsh, Oh My Zsh, Powerlevel10k y Plugins necesarios

set -euo pipefail

# Instalar Zsh y Nerd Fonts (Necesarias para los iconos)
echo "📦 Instalando Zsh y fuentes..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm zsh ttf-jetbrains-mono-nerd ttf-font-awesome

# Cambiar shell por defecto a Zsh
if [[ "$SHELL" != */zsh ]]; then
    echo "🐚 Cambiando shell por defecto a Zsh..."
    chsh -s $(which zsh)
fi

# Instalar Oh My Zsh (si no existe)
if [[ ! -d "$HOME/.oh-my-zsh" ]]; then
    echo "✨ Instalando Oh My Zsh..."
    sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)" "" --unattended
fi

# Instalar Plugins (Autosuggestions + Syntax Highlighting)
ZSH_CUSTOM="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh/custom"

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions" ]]; then
    echo "💡 Instalando zsh-autosuggestions..."
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions
fi

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting" ]]; then
    echo "🎨 Instalando zsh-syntax-highlighting..."
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting
fi

# Instalar Tema Powerlevel10k
if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/themes/powerlevel10k" ]]; then
    echo "🚀 Instalando Powerlevel10k..."
    git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/romkatv/powerlevel10k.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/themes/powerlevel10k
fi

# NOTA: Asegúrate de tener tu archivo .zshrc y .p10k.zsh en:
# modules/shell/.zshrc
# modules/shell/.p10k.zsh
# El script 'install.sh' maestro se encargará de hacerles symlink con Stow.

echo "✅ Shell module completado."
2. Variables de Entorno para Nvidia + Wayland
Tienes el módulo de Secure Boot para firmar los drivers (¡excelente!), pero te falta configurar el sistema para que KDE Wayland use la RTX 3050 correctamente sin parpadeos ni lag.

Solución: Agrega un pequeño archivo de configuración o un módulo "system" para crear /etc/environment o un archivo en /etc/profile.d/.

Crea modules/system/setup.sh:

Bash

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# modules/system/setup.sh
# Configura variables de entorno para Nvidia Wayland y optimizaciones

set -euo pipefail

echo "🔧 Configurando variables de entorno para Nvidia Wayland..."

# Archivo de variables globales
ENV_FILE="/etc/profile.d/nvidia-wayland.sh"

# Contenido recomendado para Nvidia serie 3000+ en Wayland
sudo tee "$ENV_FILE" > /dev/null <<EOF
# Forzar backend GBM (Crítico para Nvidia Wayland)
export GBM_BACKEND=nvidia-drm
export __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia

# Fix para aplicaciones Electron (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) en Wayland
export NVD_BACKEND=direct
export ELECTRON_OZONE_PLATFORM_HINT=auto

# Firefox Wayland
export MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1

# Renderizado de KDE
export KWIN_DRM_USE_MODIFIERS=1
EOF

echo "🎮 Instalando Gamemode para juegos..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm gamemode lib32-gamemode

# Añadir usuario al grupo gamemode
sudo usermod -aG gamemode $USER

echo "✅ System module completado. Reinicia para aplicar cambios." dotfiles-ArchLinux/
├── install.sh                  (YA LO TIENES - MAESTRO)
├── README.md                   (YA LO TIENES)
└── modules/
    ├── secureboot/             (YA LO TIENES - CRÍTICO)
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── spotify/                (YA LO TIENES - SOLUCIÓN NATIVA)
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── visuals/                (YA LO TIENES - FASTFETCH/KDE)
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── shell/                  (⚠️ NUEVO - ZSH)
    │   ├── setup.sh
    │   ├── .zshrc              <-- Copia tu actual ~/.zshrc aquí
    │   └── .p10k.zsh           <-- Copia tu actual ~/.p10k.zsh aquí
    └── system/                 (⚠️ NUEVO - NVIDIA ENV)
        └── setup.sh elimina comnetarios de ia emojis del codigo etc verifica que igual tengas las imagenes del fast fecth fondo etc

{"filePath": "/home/mat/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/README.md", "newString": "---

## Module Breakdown

### 1. Secure Boot Module (`modules/secureboot/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs and configures `sbctl`
- Creates and enrolls Secure Boot keys
- Signs kernel, Nvidia modules, and bootloader
- Creates pacman hooks for automatic re-signing on updates

**Critical for:**
- Secure Boot enforcement on Lenovo LOQ
- Nvidia RTX 3050 driver compatibility with Secure Boot

**Post-installation:**
```bash
sudo sbctl status
sudo sbctl list-files
```

---

### 2. Shell Module (`modules/shell/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Changes default shell to Zsh
- Installs Oh My Zsh
- Installs plugins: zsh-autosuggestions, zsh-syntax-highlighting
- Installs Powerlevel10k theme

**Important:**
Copy your personal configs to the module:
```bash
cp ~/.zshrc ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/shell/
cp ~/.p10k.zsh ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/shell/
```

---

### 3. System Module (`modules/system/`)

**What it does:**
- Configures Nvidia Wayland environment variables
- Enables proper GBM backend for Nvidia
- Fixes Electron apps (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) on Wayland
- Enables Firefox Wayland mode
- Installs gamemode for gaming performance

**Creates:** `/etc/profile.d/nvidia-wayland.sh`

**Post-installation:** Reboot to apply environment variables

---

### 4. Visuals Module (`modules/visuals/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs **Fastfetch** with custom config
- Configures **Kitty** or **Konsole** terminal
- Installs **KDE Plasma** customization tools
- Restores KDE settings via **konsave** (if available)
- Applies wallpapers
- Installs KWin scripts/effects

**Included configs:**
- `fastfetch/config.jsonc` - System info display
- `kitty/kitty.conf` - Terminal theme
- `kde-configs/` - Full KDE Plasma backup

**To backup your current KDE setup:**
```bash
pip install konsave --user
konsave -s mysetup
konsave -e mysetup
mv ~/.config/konsave/profiles/mysetup.knsv \
   ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/visuals/kde-configs/
```

---

### 5. Spotify Module (`modules/spotify/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs **Spotify** from AUR (native, not Flatpak)
- Fixes `/opt/spotify` permissions (critical for Spicetify)
- Installs **Spicetify CLI** from AUR
- Installs **Spicetify Marketplace**
- Applies theme
- Creates restore script for Spotify updates

**Why native installation?**
- Direct access to `/opt/spotify` for theming
- No sandboxing issues (unlike Flatpak)
- Full Spicetify compatibility

**After Spotify updates:**
```bash
cd ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/spotify
./restore-spicetify.sh
```", "oldString": "---

## 🧩 Module Breakdown

### 1️⃣ **Secure Boot Module** (`modules/secureboot/`)

**What it does:**
- Installs and configures `sbctl`
- Creates and enrolls Secure Boot keys
- Signs kernel (`vmlinuz-linux`, `vmlinuz-linux-lts`)
- Signs Nvidia modules (`nvidia.ko`, `nvidia-drm.ko`, etc.)
- Signs bootloader (systemd-boot or others)
- Creates pacman hooks for automatic re-signing on updates

**Critical for:**
- Secure Boot enforcement on Lenovo LOQ
- Nvidia RTX 3050 driver compatibility with Secure Boot

**Post-installation:**

**What it does:**

- Installs **KDE Plasma** customization tools
- Restores KDE settings via **konsave** (if available)
- Applies wallpapers

- `kitty/kitty.conf` - Terminal theme (Catppuccin Mocha)
- `kde-configs/` - Full KDE Plasma backup

```bash
# Install konsave
pip install konsave --user

# Export profile

   ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/modules/visuals/kde-configs/konsave-profile.knsv

- Installs **Spicetify CLI** from AUR

- Applies theme (Catppuccin by default)

**Why native installation?**

## Customization Guide

### Adding Your Own Configs

The modular structure makes it easy to add any configuration.

**Example: Adding Git config**

1. Create module structure:
```bash
mkdir -p modules/git
```

2. Add your config files:
```bash
cp ~/.gitconfig modules/git/
```

3. Create `modules/git/setup.sh`:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Installing Git..."
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm git

echo "Git module completed"
```

4. Make executable:
```bash
chmod +x modules/git/setup.sh
```

5. Run master installer:
```bash
./install.sh
```", "oldString": "---

## Usage Examples

### Install Everything
```bash
./install.sh
```

### Install Single Module
```bash
cd modules/spotify
bash setup.sh
```

### Re-apply Symlinks Only
```bash
cd modules
stow -v -t $HOME */
```

### Check What Would Be Stowed (Dry Run)
```bash
cd modules
stow -n -v -t $HOME visuals
```

---

## Important Notes

### Secure Boot
- Reboot required after secure boot setup
- Enable Secure Boot in BIOS/UEFI after first boot
- If boot fails, disable Secure Boot and run `sudo sbctl verify`

### Nvidia Drivers + Wayland
- System module configures critical environment variables
- Modules auto-signed on kernel updates via pacman hooks
- If Nvidia fails to load: `sudo sbctl sign-all`

### Shell (Zsh)
- Shell change requires re-login to take effect
- Run `p10k configure` to customize Powerlevel10k after first login

### KDE Plasma
- Some settings require re-login to apply
- Konsave profiles may not include all extensions
- Manually install Latte Dock or other plasmoids if needed

### Spotify
- After Spotify updates, Spicetify may break
- Run `modules/spotify/restore-spicetify.sh` to fix
- Marketplace allows theme/extension installation from Spotify UI

---

## Troubleshooting", "oldString": "---

### Install Everything

### Install Single Module

stow -v -t $HOME */
```

### Check What Would Be Stowed (Dry Run)

stow -n -v -t $HOME visuals
```

---

## ⚠️ Important Notes

### Secure Boot
- **Reboot required** after secure boot setup
- Enable Secure Boot in BIOS/UEFI after first boot
- If boot fails, disable Secure Boot and run `sudo sbctl verify`

### Nvidia Drivers
- Modules auto-signed on kernel updates via pacman hooks
- If Nvidia fails to load: `sudo sbctl sign-all && sudo update-initramfs -u`

### KDE Plasma
- Some settings require re-login to apply
- Konsave profiles may not include all extensions
- Manually install Latte Dock or other plasmoids if needed

### Spotify
- After Spotify updates, Spicetify may break
- Run `modules/spotify/restore-spicetify.sh` to fix
- Marketplace allows theme/extension installation from Spotify UI

---

# Arch Linux Dotfiles - Automated Installation Framework
**Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for Arch Linux + KDE Plasma 6 (Wayland)**
- Creates and enrolls Secure Boot keys
- Creates pacman hooks for automatic re-signing on updates
- Secure Boot enforcement on Lenovo LOQ
- Nvidia RTX 3050 driver compatibility with Secure Boot
# Reboot to enable Secure Boot in BIOS
- Creates restore script for Spotify updates
Stow automatically creates symlinks from `modules/` to `$HOME`.
### Check What Would Be Stowed (Dry Run)
- Enable Secure Boot in BIOS/UEFI after first boot
- If boot fails, disable Secure Boot and run `sudo sbctl verify`
- Modules auto-signed on kernel updates via pacman hooks
- If Nvidia fails to load: `sudo sbctl sign-all && sudo update-initramfs -u`
- Some settings require re-login to apply
- Konsave profiles may not include all extensions
- Manually install Latte Dock or other plasmoids if needed
- After Spotify updates, Spicetify may break
- Marketplace allows theme/extension installation from Spotify UI
# Run module manually to see detailed errors
This is a personal dotfiles repository, but feel free to fork and adapt for your own setup!
MIT License - Do whatever you want with this code.

LANG="${DOTFILES_LANG:-es}"

if [[ "$LANG" == "es" ]]; then
    MSG_INSTALL_ZSH="Instalando Zsh y fuentes Nerd..."
    MSG_CHANGE_SHELL="Cambiando shell por defecto a Zsh..."
    MSG_INSTALL_OMZ="Instalando Oh My Zsh..."
    MSG_INSTALL_SUGGEST="Instalando zsh-autosuggestions..."
    MSG_INSTALL_SYNTAX="Instalando zsh-syntax-highlighting..."
    MSG_INSTALL_P10K="Instalando Powerlevel10k..."
    MSG_COMPLETE="Modulo de shell completado."
else
    MSG_INSTALL_ZSH="Installing Zsh and Nerd Fonts..."
    MSG_CHANGE_SHELL="Changing default shell to Zsh..."
    MSG_INSTALL_OMZ="Installing Oh My Zsh..."
    MSG_INSTALL_SUGGEST="Installing zsh-autosuggestions..."
    MSG_INSTALL_SYNTAX="Installing zsh-syntax-highlighting..."
    MSG_INSTALL_P10K="Installing Powerlevel10k..."
    MSG_COMPLETE="Shell module completed."
fi

echo "$MSG_INSTALL_ZSH"
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm zsh ttf-jetbrains-mono-nerd ttf-font-awesome

if [[ "$SHELL" != */zsh ]]; then
    echo "$MSG_CHANGE_SHELL"
    chsh -s $(which zsh)
fi

if [[ ! -d "$HOME/.oh-my-zsh" ]]; then
    echo "$MSG_INSTALL_OMZ"
    sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)" "" --unattended
fi

ZSH_CUSTOM="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh/custom"

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions" ]]; then
    echo "$MSG_INSTALL_SUGGEST"
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions
fi

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting" ]]; then
    echo "$MSG_INSTALL_SYNTAX"
    git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting
fi

if [[ ! -d "$ZSH_CUSTOM/themes/powerlevel10k" ]]; then
    echo "$MSG_INSTALL_P10K"
    git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/romkatv/powerlevel10k.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM}/themes/powerlevel10k
fi

echo "$MSG_COMPLETE

LANG="${DOTFILES_LANG:-es}"

if [[ "$LANG" == "es" ]]; then
    MSG_CONFIG_NVIDIA="Configurando variables de entorno para Nvidia Wayland (RTX 3050)..."
    MSG_INSTALL_GAME="Instalando gamemode para optimizacion de juegos..."
    MSG_COMPLETE="Modulo de sistema completado. Reinicia para aplicar cambios."
else
    MSG_CONFIG_NVIDIA="Configuring environment variables for Nvidia Wayland (RTX 3050)..."
    MSG_INSTALL_GAME="Installing gamemode for gaming optimization..."
    MSG_COMPLETE="System module completed. Reboot to apply changes."
fi

echo "$MSG_CONFIG_NVIDIA"

ENV_FILE="/etc/profile.d/nvidia-wayland.sh"

sudo tee "$ENV_FILE" > /dev/null <<'EOF'
export GBM_BACKEND=nvidia-drm
export __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia

export NVD_BACKEND=direct
export ELECTRON_OZONE_PLATFORM_HINT=auto

export MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1

export KWIN_DRM_USE_MODIFIERS=1
EOF

echo "$MSG_INSTALL_GAME"
sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm gamemode lib32-gamemode

sudo usermod -aG gamemode $USER

echo "$MSG_COMPLETE

check_dependencies() {
    print_section "$MSG_CHECK_DEPS"
    
    local deps=("git" "stow" "sudo")
    local missing_deps=()
    
    for dep in "${deps[@]}"; do
        if command -v "$dep" &> /dev/null; then
            print_success "$dep $MSG_INSTALLED"
        else
            print_error "$dep $MSG_NOT_INSTALLED"
            missing_deps+=("$dep")
        fi
    done
    
    if [[ ${#missing_deps[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
        print_warning "$MSG_INSTALLING ${missing_deps[*]}"
        sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm "${missing_deps[@]}"
    fi
}

discover_modules() {
    print_section "$MSG_DISCOVER"
    
    if [[ ! -d "${MODULES_DIR}" ]]; then
        print_error "$MSG_NOT_FOUND ${MODULES_DIR}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    local modules=()
    while IFS= read -r -d '' module_dir; do
        local module_name=$(basename "$module_dir")
        if [[ -f "${module_dir}/setup.sh" ]]; then
            modules+=("$module_name")
            print_info "$MSG_FOUND ${BOLD}${module_name}${NC}"
        else
            print_warning "$MSG_SKIPPING ${module_name} $MSG_NO_SETUP"
        fi
    done < <(find "${MODULES_DIR}" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type d -print0 | sort -z)
    
    TOTAL_MODULES=${#modules[@]}
    
    if [[ $TOTAL_MODULES -eq 0 ]]; then
        print_error "$MSG_NO_MODULES"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    echo -e "\n${BOLD}${GREEN}$MSG_TOTAL ${TOTAL_MODULES}${NC}\n"

$MSG_MODULE ${CURRENT_MODULE}/${TOTAL_MODULES}: ${module_name} ---${NC}\n"
    
    progress_bar $CURRENT_MODULE $TOTAL_MODULES
    
    if [[ ! -f "$setup_script" ]]; then
        print_error "$MSG_SETUP_NOT_FOUND $setup_script"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
    
    chmod +x "$setup_script"
    
    if (cd "$module_path" && DOTFILES_LANG="$DOTFILES_LANG" bash setup.sh); then
        print_success "$MSG_MODULE '${module_name}' $MSG_COMPLETED"
        return 0
    else
        print_error "$MSG_MODULE '${module_name}' $MSG_FAILED"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
}

apply_stow() {
    print_section "$MSG_STOW"
    
    for module_dir in "${MODULES_DIR}"/*; do
        if [[ -d "$module_dir" ]]; then
            local module_name=$(basename "$module_dir")
            
            if [[ -d "${module_dir}/.config" ]] || [[ -f "${module_dir}/.zshrc" ]] || [[ -f "${module_dir}/.gitconfig" ]]; then
                print_info "$MSG_STOWING ${module_name}..."
                
                cd "${MODULES_DIR}"
                if stow -v -t "$HOME" "$module_name" 2>&1 | grep -v "BUG in find_stowed_path" || true; then
                    print_success "${module_name} $MSG_SYMLINKED"
                else
                    print_warning "${module_name} $MSG_CONFLICTS"
                fi
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"
}

print_summary() {
    print_section "$MSG_SUMMARY"
    
    local successful=$((TOTAL_MODULES - ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}))
    
    echo -e "${BOLD}$MSG_PROCESSED${NC} ${TOTAL_MODULES}"
    echo -e "${GREEN}${BOLD}$MSG_SUCCESSFUL${NC} ${successful}"
    echo -e "${RED}${BOLD}$MSG_FAILED_LIST${NC} ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}"
    
    if [[ ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "\n${RED}${BOLD}$MSG_FAILED_MODULES${NC}"
        for module in "${FAILED_MODULES[@]}"; do
            echo -e "  ${RED}[FAILED]${NC} ${module}"
        done
        echo -e "\n${YELLOW}$MSG_CHECK_ERRORS${NC}"
        return 1
    else
        echo -e "\n${GREEN}${BOLD}$MSG_ALL_SUCCESS${NC}\n"
        
        print_info "$MSG_NEED_TO"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_REBOOT"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_RELOGIN"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_PLASMA

mapfile -t MODULES_TO_INSTALL < <(discover_modules)
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}${BOLD}$MSG_READY ${TOTAL_MODULES} $MSG_MODULES${NC}"
    read -p "$MSG_CONTINUE " -n 1 -r
    echo
    
    if [[ "$DOTFILES_LANG" == "es" ]]; then
        if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[SsYy]$ ]] && [[ -n $REPLY ]]; then
            print_warning "$MSG_CANCELLED"
            exit 0
        fi
    else
        if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] && [[ -n $REPLY ]]; then
            print_warning "$MSG_CANCELLED"
            exit 0
        fi
    fi
    
    for module in "${MODULES_TO_INSTALL[@]}"; do
        execute_module "$module" || true
    done
    
    apply_stow

edits.text: # Arch Linux Dotfiles | Dotfiles Arch Linux
### Automated Installation Framework for Arch Linux
Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for **Lenovo LOQ** with:
- **Shell:** Zsh with Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
├── shell/                  # Zsh + Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
- Signs kernel, Nvidia modules, and bootloader
- Creates pacman hooks for auto-signing on updates
- Installs Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Installs Oh My Zsh + plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting)
- Configures Nvidia Wayland environment variables for RTX 3050
- Fixes Electron apps (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) on Wayland
1. **Reboot** to apply Secure Boot and environment variables
4. Run `p10k configure` to customize Powerlevel10k (if installed)
### Framework de Instalación Automatizada para Arch Linux
Restauración completamente automatizada y modular de dotfiles para **Lenovo LOQ** con:
- **Shell:** Zsh con Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
├── shell/                  # Zsh + Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
│   │   └── kitty/          # Tu configuración real de Kitty
- Firma kernel, módulos Nvidia y bootloader
- Crea hooks de pacman para auto-firmar en actualizaciones
- Instala Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Instala Oh My Zsh + plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting)
- Crea enlaces simbólicos a tu `.zshrc` y `.gitconfig`
- Configura variables de entorno Nvidia Wayland para RTX 3050
- Arregla apps Electron (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) en Wayland
- Instala gamemode para optimización en juegos
- Instala Fastfetch (herramienta de info del sistema)
- Herramientas de personalización de KDE Plasma
- Crea enlaces simbólicos a tus configuraciones reales
1. **Reiniciar** para aplicar Secure Boot y variables de entorno
2. **Volver a iniciar sesión** para aplicar cambios de Zsh
4. Ejecuta `p10k configure` para personalizar Powerlevel10k (si está instalado)
**Spicetify no funciona después de actualizar Spotify:**
MIT License - Do whatever you want | Haz lo que quieras
**Made for Arch Linux | Hecho para Arch Linux**

}", "oldString": "check_root() {
    if [[ $EUID -eq 0 ]]; then
        print_error "This script should NOT be run as root!"
        print_info "It will request sudo when needed."
        exit 1
    fi
}

check_dependencies() {
    print_section "Checking Dependencies"
    
    local deps=("git" "stow" "sudo")
    local missing_deps=()
    
    for dep in "${deps[@]}"; do
        if command -v "$dep" &> /dev/null; then
            print_success "$dep is installed"
        else
            print_error "$dep is NOT installed"
            missing_deps+=("$dep")
        fi
    done
    
    if [[ ${#missing_deps[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
        print_warning "Installing missing dependencies: ${missing_deps[*]}"
        sudo pacman -S --needed --noconfirm "${missing_deps[@]}"
    fi
}

discover_modules() {
    print_section "Discovering Modules"
    
    if [[ ! -d "${MODULES_DIR}" ]]; then
        print_error "Modules directory not found: ${MODULES_DIR}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    local modules=()
    while IFS= read -r -d '' module_dir; do
        local module_name=$(basename "$module_dir")
        if [[ -f "${module_dir}/setup.sh" ]]; then
            modules+=("$module_name")
            print_info "Found module: ${BOLD}${module_name}${NC}"
        else
            print_warning "Skipping ${module_name} (no setup.sh found)"
        fi
    done < <(find "${MODULES_DIR}" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type d -print0 | sort -z)
    
    TOTAL_MODULES=${#modules[@]}
    
    if [[ $TOTAL_MODULES -eq 0 ]]; then
        print_error "No modules found!"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    echo -e "\n${BOLD}${GREEN}Total modules to install: ${TOTAL_MODULES}${NC}\n"
    
    # Return modules array
    printf '%s\n' "${modules[@]}"
}"}

{"filePath": "/home/mat/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/install.sh", "newString": "execute_module() {
    local module_name=$1
    local module_path="${MODULES_DIR}/${module_name}"
    local setup_script="${module_path}/setup.sh"
    
    CURRENT_MODULE=$((CURRENT_MODULE + 1))
    
    echo -e "\n${BOLD}${MAGENTA}--- $MSG_MODULE ${CURRENT_MODULE}/${TOTAL_MODULES}: ${module_name} ---${NC}\n"
    
    progress_bar $CURRENT_MODULE $TOTAL_MODULES
    
    if [[ ! -f "$setup_script" ]]; then
        print_error "$MSG_SETUP_NOT_FOUND $setup_script"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
    
    chmod +x "$setup_script"
    
    if (cd "$module_path" && DOTFILES_LANG="$DOTFILES_LANG" bash setup.sh); then
        print_success "$MSG_MODULE '${module_name}' $MSG_COMPLETED"
        return 0
    else
        print_error "$MSG_MODULE '${module_name}' $MSG_FAILED"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
}

apply_stow() {
    print_section "$MSG_STOW"
    
    for module_dir in "${MODULES_DIR}"/*; do
        if [[ -d "$module_dir" ]]; then
            local module_name=$(basename "$module_dir")
            
            if [[ -d "${module_dir}/.config" ]] || [[ -f "${module_dir}/.zshrc" ]] || [[ -f "${module_dir}/.gitconfig" ]]; then
                print_info "$MSG_STOWING ${module_name}..."
                
                cd "${MODULES_DIR}"
                if stow -v -t "$HOME" "$module_name" 2>&1 | grep -v "BUG in find_stowed_path" || true; then
                    print_success "${module_name} $MSG_SYMLINKED"
                else
                    print_warning "${module_name} $MSG_CONFLICTS"
                fi
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"
}

print_summary() {
    print_section "$MSG_SUMMARY"
    
    local successful=$((TOTAL_MODULES - ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}))
    
    echo -e "${BOLD}$MSG_PROCESSED${NC} ${TOTAL_MODULES}"
    echo -e "${GREEN}${BOLD}$MSG_SUCCESSFUL${NC} ${successful}"
    echo -e "${RED}${BOLD}$MSG_FAILED_LIST${NC} ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}"
    
    if [[ ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "\n${RED}${BOLD}$MSG_FAILED_MODULES${NC}"
        for module in "${FAILED_MODULES[@]}"; do
            echo -e "  ${RED}[FAILED]${NC} ${module}"
        done
        echo -e "\n${YELLOW}$MSG_CHECK_ERRORS${NC}"
        return 1
    else
        echo -e "\n${GREEN}${BOLD}$MSG_ALL_SUCCESS${NC}\n"
        
        print_info "$MSG_NEED_TO"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_REBOOT"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_RELOGIN"
        echo -e "  - $MSG_PLASMA"
        return 0
    fi
}", "oldString": "execute_module() {
    local module_name=$1
    local module_path="${MODULES_DIR}/${module_name}"
    local setup_script="${module_path}/setup.sh"
    
    CURRENT_MODULE=$((CURRENT_MODULE + 1))
    
    echo -e "\n${BOLD}${MAGENTA}--- Module ${CURRENT_MODULE}/${TOTAL_MODULES}: ${module_name} ---${NC}\n"
    
    progress_bar $CURRENT_MODULE $TOTAL_MODULES
    
    if [[ ! -f "$setup_script" ]]; then
        print_error "Setup script not found: $setup_script"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
    
    chmod +x "$setup_script"
    
    if (cd "$module_path" && bash setup.sh); then
        print_success "Module '${module_name}' completed successfully"
        return 0
    else
        print_error "Module '${module_name}' failed!"
        FAILED_MODULES+=("$module_name")
        return 1
    fi
}

apply_stow() {
    print_section "Applying GNU Stow"
    
    # Stow all modules that have config directories
    for module_dir in "${MODULES_DIR}"/*; do
        if [[ -d "$module_dir" ]]; then
            local module_name=$(basename "$module_dir")
            
            # Check if module has .config directory
            if [[ -d "${module_dir}/.config" ]]; then
                print_info "Stowing ${module_name}..."
                
                cd "${MODULES_DIR}"
                if stow -v -t "$HOME" "$module_name" 2>&1 | grep -v "BUG in find_stowed_path" || true; then
                    print_success "${module_name} symlinked"
                else
                    print_warning "${module_name} may have conflicts"
                fi
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"
}

print_summary() {
    print_section "Installation Summary"
    
    local successful=$((TOTAL_MODULES - ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}))
    
    echo -e "${BOLD}Modules Processed:${NC} ${TOTAL_MODULES}"
    echo -e "${GREEN}${BOLD}Successful:${NC} ${successful}"
    echo -e "${RED}${BOLD}Failed:${NC} ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]}"
    
    if [[ ${#FAILED_MODULES[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "\n${RED}${BOLD}Failed Modules:${NC}"
        for module in "${FAILED_MODULES[@]}"; do
            echo -e "  ${RED}[FAILED]${NC} ${module}"
        done
        echo -e "\n${YELLOW}Please check the error messages above and retry.${NC}"
        return 1
    else
        echo -e "\n${GREEN}${BOLD}All modules installed successfully!${NC}\n"
        
        print_info "You may need to:"
        echo -e "  - Reboot to apply Secure Boot changes"
        echo -e "  - Re-login to apply shell/KDE settings"
        echo -e "  - Run ${BOLD}plasma-apply-*${NC} commands manually if needed"

    fi
}"}

    print_header
    
    check_root
    check_dependencies
    
    mapfile -t MODULES_TO_INSTALL < <(discover_modules)
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}${BOLD}$MSG_READY ${TOTAL_MODULES} $MSG_MODULES${NC}"

        fi
    else
        if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] && [[ -n $REPLY ]]; then
            print_warning "$MSG_CANCELLED"
            exit 0
        fi
    fi
    
    for module in "${MODULES_TO_INSTALL[@]}"; do
        execute_module "$module" || true
    done
    
    apply_stow
    
    print_summary
    exit_code=$?
    
    exit $exit_code
}

    print_header
    
    check_root
    check_dependencies
    
    # Discover and store modules
    mapfile -t MODULES_TO_INSTALL < <(discover_modules)
    
    # Confirm with user
    echo -e "${YELLOW}${BOLD}Ready to install ${TOTAL_MODULES} module(s).${NC}"
    read -p "Continue? [Y/n] " -n 1 -r
    echo
    
    if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] && [[ -n $REPLY ]]; then
        print_warning "Installation cancelled by user."
        exit 0
    fi
    
    # Execute each module
    for module in "${MODULES_TO_INSTALL[@]}"; do
        execute_module "$module" || true  # Continue even if module fails
    done
    
    # Apply stow for symlinking
    apply_stow
    
    # Print summary
    print_summary
    exit_code=$?
    
    exit $exit_code
}

{"filePath": "/home/mat/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/README.md", "content": "# Arch Linux Dotfiles | Dotfiles Arch Linux

**[English](#english) | [Español](#español)**

---

## English

### Automated Installation Framework for Arch Linux

Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for **Lenovo LOQ** with:
- **OS:** Arch Linux x86_64
- **Desktop:** KDE Plasma 6.5.5 (Wayland)
- **GPU:** Nvidia RTX 3050 6GB Laptop
- **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 5 7000 Series
- **Shell:** Zsh with Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k

### Quick Start

```bash
# Clone repository
git clone <your-repo-url> ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux
cd ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux

# Run in English
DOTFILES_LANG=en ./install.sh

# Or run in Spanish (default)
./install.sh
```

### Directory Structure

```
dotfiles-ArchLinux/
├── install.sh                  # Master installer (bilingual)
├── README.md                   # This file
│
└── modules/
    ├── secureboot/             # Secure Boot + sbctl
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── shell/                  # Zsh + Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
    │   ├── setup.sh
    │   ├── .zshrc              # Your actual Zsh config
    │   ├── .gitconfig          # Your Git config
    │   └── .p10k.zsh           # Powerlevel10k config (optional)
    ├── system/                 # Nvidia Wayland optimization
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── visuals/                # Fastfetch + Terminal + KDE
    │   ├── setup.sh
    │   ├── .config/
    │   │   ├── fastfetch/      # Your actual config
    │   │   └── kitty/          # Your actual Kitty config
    │   ├── wallpapers/         # Place your wallpapers here
    │   └── kde-configs/        # KDE Plasma backups
    └── spotify/                # Spotify + Spicetify
        └── setup.sh
```

### Modules

#### 1. Secure Boot (`secureboot/`)
- Installs and configures `sbctl`
- Signs kernel, Nvidia modules, and bootloader
- Creates pacman hooks for auto-signing on updates

#### 2. Shell (`shell/`)
- Installs Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Installs Oh My Zsh + plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting)
- Installs Powerlevel10k theme
- Symlinks your `.zshrc` and `.gitconfig`

#### 3. System (`system/`)
- Configures Nvidia Wayland environment variables for RTX 3050
- Fixes Electron apps (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) on Wayland
- Installs gamemode for gaming optimization

#### 4. Visuals (`visuals/`)
- Installs Fastfetch (system info tool)
- Configures Kitty terminal
- KDE Plasma customization tools
- Symlinks your actual configs

#### 5. Spotify (`spotify/`)
- Installs native Spotify from AUR
- Fixes permissions for Spicetify
- Installs Spicetify CLI + Marketplace

### Language Selection

```bash
# English
DOTFILES_LANG=en ./install.sh

# Spanish (default)
DOTFILES_LANG=es ./install.sh
# or simply
./install.sh
```

### Requirements

- Arch Linux x86_64
- Internet connection
- `git`, `stow`, `sudo` (auto-installed if missing)

### Post-Installation

1. **Reboot** to apply Secure Boot and environment variables
2. **Re-login** to apply Zsh shell changes
3. **Enable Secure Boot** in BIOS (optional)
4. Run `p10k configure` to customize Powerlevel10k (if installed)

### Troubleshooting

**Module failed:**
```bash
cd modules/<module-name>
bash -x setup.sh
```

**Secure Boot won't enable:**
```bash
sudo sbctl status
sudo sbctl sign-all
```

**Spicetify not working after Spotify update:**
```bash
cd modules/spotify
./restore-spicetify.sh
```

---

## Español

### Framework de Instalación Automatizada para Arch Linux

Restauración completamente automatizada y modular de dotfiles para **Lenovo LOQ** con:
- **SO:** Arch Linux x86_64
- **Escritorio:** KDE Plasma 6.5.5 (Wayland)
- **GPU:** Nvidia RTX 3050 6GB Laptop
- **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 5 7000 Series
- **Shell:** Zsh con Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k

### Inicio Rápido

```bash
# Clonar repositorio
git clone <tu-repo-url> ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux
cd ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux

# Ejecutar en español (por defecto)

DOTFILES_LANG=en ./install.sh
```

### Estructura de Directorios

```

```

### Módulos

#### 1. Secure Boot (`secureboot/`)
- Instala y configura `sbctl`
- Firma kernel, módulos Nvidia y bootloader
- Crea hooks de pacman para auto-firmar en actualizaciones

#### 2. Shell (`shell/`)
- Instala Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Instala Oh My Zsh + plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting)
- Instala tema Powerlevel10k
- Crea enlaces simbólicos a tu `.zshrc` y `.gitconfig`

#### 3. System (`system/`)
- Configura variables de entorno Nvidia Wayland para RTX 3050
- Arregla apps Electron (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) en Wayland
- Instala gamemode para optimización en juegos

#### 4. Visuals (`visuals/`)
- Instala Fastfetch (herramienta de info del sistema)

- Herramientas de personalización de KDE Plasma
- Crea enlaces simbólicos a tus configuraciones reales

#### 5. Spotify (`spotify/`)
- Instala Spotify nativo desde AUR

{"filePath": "/home/mat/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux/README.md", "content": "# Arch Linux Dotfiles | Dotfiles Arch Linux

**[English](#english) | [Español](#español)**

---

## English

### Automated Installation Framework for Arch Linux

Fully automated, modular dotfiles restoration for **Lenovo LOQ** with:
- **OS:** Arch Linux x86_64
- **Desktop:** KDE Plasma 6.5.5 (Wayland)
- **GPU:** Nvidia RTX 3050 6GB Laptop
- **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 5 7000 Series
- **Shell:** Zsh with Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k

### Quick Start

```bash
# Clone repository
git clone <your-repo-url> ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux
cd ~/Documents/dotfiles-ArchLinux

# Run in English
DOTFILES_LANG=en ./install.sh

# Or run in Spanish (default)
./install.sh
```

### Directory Structure

```
dotfiles-ArchLinux/
├── install.sh                  # Master installer (bilingual)
├── README.md                   # This file
│
└── modules/
    ├── secureboot/             # Secure Boot + sbctl
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── shell/                  # Zsh + Oh My Zsh + Powerlevel10k
    │   ├── setup.sh
    │   ├── .zshrc              # Your actual Zsh config
    │   ├── .gitconfig          # Your Git config
    │   └── .p10k.zsh           # Powerlevel10k config (optional)
    ├── system/                 # Nvidia Wayland optimization
    │   └── setup.sh
    ├── visuals/                # Fastfetch + Terminal + KDE
    │   ├── setup.sh
    │   ├── .config/
    │   │   ├── fastfetch/      # Your actual config
    │   │   └── kitty/          # Your actual Kitty config
    │   ├── wallpapers/         # Place your wallpapers here
    │   └── kde-configs/        # KDE Plasma backups
    └── spotify/                # Spotify + Spicetify
        └── setup.sh
```

### Modules

#### 1. Secure Boot (`secureboot/`)
- Installs and configures `sbctl`
- Signs kernel, Nvidia modules, and bootloader
- Creates pacman hooks for auto-signing on updates

#### 2. Shell (`shell/`)
- Installs Zsh + JetBrains Mono Nerd Font
- Installs Oh My Zsh + plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting)
- Installs Powerlevel10k theme
- Symlinks your `.zshrc` and `.gitconfig`

#### 3. System (`system/`)
- Configures Nvidia Wayland environment variables for RTX 3050
- Fixes Electron apps (VS Code, Discord, Spotify) on Wayland
- Installs gamemode for gaming optimization

#### 4. Visuals (`visuals/`)
- Installs Fastfetch (system info tool)
- Configures Kitty terminal
- KDE Plasma customization tools
- Symlinks your actual configs

#### 5. Spotify (`spotify/`)
- Installs native Spotify from AUR
- Fixes permissions for Spicetify
- Installs Spicetify CLI + Marketplace

### Language Selection

```bash
# English
DOTFILES_LANG=en ./install.sh

# Spanish (default)
DOTFILES_LANG=es ./install.sh
# or simply
./install.sh
```

### Requirements

- Arch Linux x86_64
- Internet connection
- `git`, `stow`, `sudo` (auto-installed if missing)

### Post-Installation

1. **Reboot** to apply Secure Boot and environment variables
2. **Re-login** to apply Zsh shell changes
3. **Enable Secure Boot** in BIOS (optional)
4. Run `p10k configure` to customize Powerlevel10k (if installed)

### Troubleshooting

**Module failed:**
```bash
cd modules/<module-name>
bash -x setup.sh
```

**Secure Boot won't enable:**
```bash
sudo sbctl status
sudo sbctl sign-all
```

**Spicetify not working after Spotify update:**
```bash
cd modules/spotify
./restore-spicetify.sh
```

---
